heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 30 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 6.0°C), outside temperature (up 4.9°C), and inside temperature (up 2.6°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 274 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 418 m), feels like temperature (down 3.4°C), and dew point temperature (down 3.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 273.6m lower than yesterday, 317.9m lower than the past week, 418.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 675m to 1900m and averaged 827.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, overcast skies with low cloud, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (90%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
